formElement.label: Configuration name
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port, and credentials are retrieved from the specified plugin configuration.
formElement.htmlDocumentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port, and credentials are retrieved from the specified plugin configuration.

formElement.label: Connection factory name
formElement.documentation: Unique name of the connection factory that is created.

formElement.label: JMS module name
formElement.documentation: Name of the JMS module where the connection factory is created.

formElement.label: Subscription sharing policy
formElement.documentation: Connection factory subscription sharing policy used to control which subscribers can access new subscriptions.

formElement.label: Client ID Policy
formElement.documentation: Client ID policy to specify if more than one JMS connection can use the same client ID. Oracle recommends setting the client ID policy to *Unrestricted* if sharing durable subscribers. Subscriptions created with different client ID policies are always treated as independent subscriptions.
formElement.htmlDocumentation: Client ID policy to specify if more than one JMS connection can use the same client ID. Oracle recommends setting the client ID policy to Unrestricted if sharing durable subscribers. Subscriptions created with different client ID policies are always treated as independent subscriptions.

formElement.label: JNDI name
formElement.documentation: JNDI name used to look up the connection factory, using JNDI lookup. If the connection factory is created without passing this parameter, it can be only used in an application-scoped context.

formElement.label: Maximum Messages per Session
formElement.documentation: Number of messages that can be queued for an asynchronous session. Default is *10*.
formElement.htmlDocumentation: Number of messages that can be queued for an asynchronous session. Default is 10.

formElement.label: XA connection factory enabled?
formElement.documentation: If selected, this connection factory creates XA queues and XA topics to accommodate JTA aware transactions. Default is *Yes*.

formElement.label: Subdeployment name
formElement.documentation: Name of the subdeployment. Required only if you want to use advanced targeting, and not the default targeting.

formElement.label: Target WLS Instance List
formElement.documentation: Comma-delimited set of Weblogic server instances (standalone or cluster) that the connection factory is targeted to. Required only if the *Subdeployment name* parameter is specified.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Comma-delimited set of Weblogic server instances (standalone or cluster) that the connection factory is targeted to.
Required only if the Subdeployment name is specified.

formElement.label: Target JMS Server List
formElement.documentation: Comma-delimited set of JMS servers that the connection factory is targeted to. Required only if Subdeployment Name is specified.

formElement.label: Update Action
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
The update action to take when a connection factory with the same name already exists:
Do nothing (default): No action is taken upon an update (for example, it will be a NO-OP).
Remove and create: The existing connection factory is removed, and it is recreated based on the new parameters passed.
Selective update: The existing connection factory is updated only for parameters that are designed to be updated out-of-the-box.

formElement.label: Additional options
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Pass related parameters that pertain to delivery, client, transaction, or flow control. For example, DefaultDeliveryParams.DefaultPriority=5.
Several options are separated by a newline:
DefaultDeliveryParams.DefaultPriority=5 FlowControlParams.FlowMaximum=500 FlowControlParams.FlowControlEnabled=true
